articles.title: Greetings to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Abdel Fattah alÔºçSisi, president of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on Sunday, the anniversary of the July 23 revolution in Egypt.
					 The message expressed the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would invariably develop, wishing Egypt progress, prosperity and stability under the leadership of the president.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Egypt
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Egypt
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Sunday sent a message of greeting to Sherif Ismail, prime minister of Egypt, on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the national holiday of the Egyptian people.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would strengthen, the message wished the prime minister bigger success in his work for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Komdok Mining Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Komdok Mining Complex
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju inspected the Komdok Mining Complex.
					 He went round the third dressing plant, Ko Kyong Chan-led Hero Workteam of the April 5 Pit at the Kumgol Mine, sleepers production worksite, etc. to encourage the workers in a drive for greeting the Conference of Mallima Frontrunners with unprecedented labor feats.
					
					 A meeting of relevant officials, held on the spot, stressed the important position and duty of the Tanchon and Komdok area mines and industrial factories in the nation's economic development and the improvement of the standard of the people's living. It also underlined the need for the relevant units to provide equipment and raw and other materials in good time.
					
					 Earlier, the premier toured the fire brick production process under construction at the Taehung Youth Hero Mine and called for completing the project ahead of schedule.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Congratulates Kim Jong Un on War Victory Day
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Congratulates Kim Jong Un on War Victory Day
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The basket and letter were handed over to Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by Roman O. Jimenez Ortega, military attache of the Cuban embassy who is doyen of the corps, on Monday.

articles.title: Korean Women Organizations Calls for Final Settlement of Japan's Hideous Crimes
articles.content:
Korean Women Organizations Calls for Final Settlement of Japan's Hideous Crimes
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Women Sub-Committee of the North Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, the Women Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration, the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan and the South Korean Women Association for Democracy in Japan sent an appeal to all compatriots at home and abroad Monday on the lapse of 110 years after Japan's fabrication of the "Jongmi Seven-Point Treaty".
					 The appeal said that the "treaty", Japan cooked up in a coercive manner by instigating pro-Japanese lackeys, was an illegal, brigandish and aggressive one unprecedented in history. Under the "treaty" Japan deprived Korea of sovereignty by completely controlling Korea's internal affairs and enforcing the "resident-general policy".
					
					 The appeal stressed that all hideous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean nation can never be written off and no statute of limitations is applicable to them.
					
					 Expressing the will of all Korean women in the north and the south and abroad to stand in the van of the struggle for forcing Japan, a sworn enemy, to pay for all its past crimes, it made the following appeal to the whole fellow countrymen at home and abroad:
					
					 Firstly, let us come out as one in the struggle for the final settlement of all hideous state-sponsored crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean nation after illegally occupying Korea.
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should rise up and get thousand-fold price for the Japanese imperialists' aggression and thrice-cursed crimes that can never be pardonable.
					
					 Let's resolutely reject the pro-Japanese remnants' sycophancy and treachery conniving at and shielding Japan's hideous crimes!
					
					 Secondly, let's turn out in a nation-wide struggle to get compensation from Japan for the crime of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army unprecedented in history without fail.
					
					 Let us fully disclose the truth behind Japan's sexual slavery crime before the world and decisively foil the shameless and cunning moves of Japan to evade its responsibility for the crime and cover it!
					
					 Let us totally nullify and repeal the humiliating and illegal "agreement" on sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army concluded by pro-Japanese traitorous forces with Japan!
					
					 Thirdly, let's intensify the struggle to smash Japan's scheme for revival of militarism and reinvasion and frustrate its unreasonable hostile acts against the Korean nation.
					
					 In Japan, "Tok Islets are part of Japan's territory" are still heard and such claim is written in the defense white paper and textbooks and the ruling quarters are visiting the Yasukuni Shrine to revive militarism.
					
					 All Koreans at home and abroad should never tolerate but thoroughly smash Japan's shameless attempt for grabbing Tok Islets.
					
					 Let us conduct more vigorous activities to check the conclusion of military agreement and the strengthening of "alliance" with Japan, an act of paving the road for Japan's reinvasion and selling the interests of the nation!
					
					 Let the whole Korean nation turn out against the Japanese authorities' unreasonable and vicious political crackdown upon the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and Koreans in Japan and abuse of their human rights!
					
					 Women organizations in the north and the south and abroad express expectation and conviction that all the compatriots would courageously come out in the nation-wide patriotic struggle to make Japan pay for all its past hideous crimes and defend the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Youths and Students Meet with War Veteran
articles.content:
Youths and Students Meet with War Veteran
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Youths and students in Pyongyang had a meeting with a war veteran at the Central Youth Hall on Monday to mark the 64th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Labor Hero Jon Ku Gang, a lecturer at the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, addressed the meeting.
					
					 The war victory day make the people recall the feats President Kim Il Sung performed by beating back with his distinguished military idea and superb strategy and tactics the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world, the lecturer said.
					
					 She noted that during the hard-fought war army surgeons and nurses of the Korean People's Army displayed matchless self-sacrificing spirit and devotion, true to the noble intention of the President who bestowed boundless love for soldiers of the People's Army.
					
					 As long as there are the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, incredible military power and single-minded unity, victory belongs to us, she said, calling on the youths and students to give fullest play to their wisdom and bravery in the defence of the country and building of a powerful socialist nation.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 Speakers expressed their will to be human bullets and bombs protecting respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, bearing in mind the spirit of defending the leader unto death, the spirit of defending the country displayed by the revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 They stressed that they will fully display the might of the unit of brave generals for implementing the cause of Juche revolution trained under the peerless great persons of Mt Paektu and win the final victory of July 27 without fail, if a war breaks out.
					
					 Attending the meeting were Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., the youth league, and league officials.

articles.title: Presentation of Winners in Vocal and Recital Solo Contest of Youths and Students Held
articles.content:
Presentation of Winners in Vocal and Recital Solo Contest of Youths and Students Held
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A presentation of winners in the national vocal and recital solo contest of youths and students took place at the Central Youth Hall on Monday in celebration of the 64th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The performers sang high praises of the feats of President Kim Il Sung, an invincible and iron-willed commander and gifted strategist who led the Korean army and people to the victory in the war and thereby displayed the stamina and dignity of heroic Korea.
					
					 Its numbers included female duet "Tell, Fireworks of War Victory", accordion solo "To a Decisive Battle" and violin solo "My Song in the Trench".
					
					 The presentation ended with chorus "We Will Defend General Kim Jong Un with Our Lives". It showed well the revolutionary enthusiasm of the five million-strong youth vanguard to bring the final victory under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Among the audience were Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, and its officials, youths and students.

articles.title: Art Performance of Youths Celebrates War Victory Day
articles.content:
Art Performance of Youths Celebrates War Victory Day
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League gave a performance "July 27 of Eternal Victory" at the Central Youth Hall Monday in celebration of the 64th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The numbers of the performance, which began with chorus "Glory to General Kim Jong Un", included narration and mixed chorus "July 27 March", dance "At the Spring Site" and male quartet "Song of Pride of Guards Units".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who led the Fatherland Liberation War to the shining victory and turned the country into a full-fledged military power and nuclear weapons state.
					
					 Among the audience were Ri Il Hwan, department director of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, and Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., Youth League, and its officials and youths and students.

articles.title: Swimming Contest of Officials Held
articles.content:
Swimming Contest of Officials Held
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A swimming contest among officials of commissions, ministries and national institutions took place at the swimming pool of the Changgwang Health Complex from July 19 to 24 on the occasion of the July-August month for maritime physical culture.
					 The contest was held in team and individual events, divided into four groups.
					
					 Coming first in team event were the Ministry of Fisheries, the Ministry of Food Procurement and Administration, the Tin Ming Alan Commercial Center and the Foreign Languages Publishing House. The first place in individuals was taken by the Revolutionary Relics Administration Guidance Bureau, the Central Industrial Design Administration, the Foreign Languages Publishing House and the Tin Ming Alan Commercial Center..

articles.title: Many People Enjoy at Rungna Pleasure Park
articles.content:
Many People Enjoy at Rungna Pleasure Park
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Five years have passed since the Rungna People's Pleasure Park was opened as a comprehensive leisure park at the Rungna Islet in Pyongyang.
					 The park is equipped with Rungna Dolphinarium, Water Park, latest amusement and leisure and service facilities.
					
					 More than 4.5 million people from all walks of life and school youth and children have visited the park for the past five years.
					
					 A large number of overseas compatriots and foreign guests, too, visited the park to spend a pleasant time. They expressed admiration at the excellent park, saying it is a product of the Workers' Party of Korea's warm love for the people and a wealth of socialist Korea where the working masses enjoy a high level of civilization.

articles.title: Efficient Machines Widely Introduced into Creating Pasture
articles.content:
Efficient Machines Widely Introduced into Creating Pasture
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Efficient farm machines have been widely introduced into creating pastures in Sepho area of the DPRK.
					 According to an official concerned at the headquarters of the stockbreeding base in the area of Sepho, the base is fully equipped with more than 10 kinds of new machines, including binder, liquid manure spreader and large mower.
					
					 Several kinds of machines have been used in creating pastures. Among them are multi-purpose machine, cultivating-furrower, seed-drill and grassland-compacting machine.
					
					 In particular, the multi-purpose machine is highly appraised among users for plowing, removing grassroots, crushing clods, leveling, furrowing and ridging simultaneously.
					
					 And the cultivating-furrower is three times higher than previous furrowers in efficiency of work.

articles.title: 1.72 Million People Visit Natural History Museum and Central Zoo
articles.content:
1.72 Million People Visit Natural History Museum and Central Zoo
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- 1.72 million working people from all walks of life, school youth and children, overseas Koreans and foreigners have visited the newly-built Natural History Museum and the remodeled Central Zoo located at the foot of Mt Taesong in Pyongyang, the DPRK for the past one year since their opening.
					 The Nature History Museum is a scientific knowledge dissemination complex based on the principles of scientific accuracy, utility and kindness.
					
					 At the museum, more than 31,000 exhibits of over 3,800 kinds are on display in a scientific and aesthetic way to help visitors acquire knowledge about nature.
					
					 The Central Zoo housing 40-odd animal sheds and theatres for animal stunts are always crowded with visitors.
					
					 In the past one year, the zoo has made a number of achievements like the establishment of a system for producing vitamin solution to improve the nutrition of animals and construction of a base for producing artificial sea salt to cultivate sea-fish.
					
					 It also succeeded in breeding neontetra, manufactured a machine for hatching birds' and reptiles' eggs and established a bulking food production system.
					
					 Thanks to the successful scientific research into breeding animals, hundreds of animals have been reproduced at the zoo.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces Attempt to Revive Conservatism in S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces Attempt to Revive Conservatism in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The issuance of "commemorative stamp" for marking the lapse of 100 years since the emergence of traitor Park Chung-hee in south Korea was cancelled.
					 The Liberal Korea Party and Parun Party members assert the issuance of stamp marking the anniversary of emergence of Park is "obligation of our generation", complaining it is unacceptable to nullify all the decisions of the preceding government, and the reason behind the cancellation should be looked into.
					
					 This is the desperate act of the group of traitors seized with extreme uneasiness, prompted by the calculation that the cancellation can be a catalyst giving momentum to the anti-conservative spirit among people of all social standings.
					
					 Park was a heinous sycophant and traitor, fascist dictator and confrontational maniac who committed indelible crimes against the nation including the south Koreans.
					
					 He enforced the unprecedented "yusin" fascist dictatorship for 18 years, turning whole south Korea into prison without bars, and built the cursed concrete walls, symbolic of national division and confrontation, on this land.
					
					 The stamp plan was railroaded last September under the manipulation of Park Geun Hye who set it as her life-long goal to ensure "reinstatement" of her father. It is the dreg of bad administration that should have been eliminated long before along with the impeachment of Park as desired by the south Korean public.
					
					 However, the group of conservatives from opposition parties has strongly reacted to the cancellation of the stamp plan, an intolerable mockery and challenge to the candlelight demonstrators.
					
					 In the past the group of conservatives held the farce of "state compilation" of history textbook distorting the truth of history and went busy setting up "Committee for Promotion of Commemoration of Park Chung-hee" and erecting a statue of the "yusin" dictator.
					
					 All facts prove that the remnants of the "yusin" group, the conservative forces are made up of sordid and heinous persons thinking of prolonging their remaining days even when they breathe their last, being driven into a tight corner.
					
					 Unless the remnants of "yusin" dictatorship are removed, the same dark era of disgrace and misfortune as the period of Park's rule can come again.
					
					 The south Koreans from all walks of life should never tolerate the wild act of the group of traitors to revive conservatism while eulogizing the "yusin" dictator, but resolutely throw it overboard.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities for "Human Rights" Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities for "Human Rights" Smear Campaign
Pyongyang July 24 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the authorities of south Korea, including the foreign minister and the unification minister, malignantly pulled up the DPRK over "human rights situation" and cried out for "cooperation with the international community" when meeting with the UN special rapporteur on "human rights issue in north Korea" on a visit to Seoul.
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Monday says this is a cynical ploy of the south Korean authorities seeking to build up a world opinion on the "human rights issue in north Korea" and thus tarnish the dignity of the DPRK and further escalate the moves to stifle the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are going reckless in the smear campaign over the already bankrupt "human rights issue", but it is a ridiculous and foolish act.
					
					 The eye-opening reality of the DPRK where the popular politics is enforced is arousing the admiration from among the progressive mankind.
					
					 In fact, for the south Korean authorities to trumpet about other's "human rights issue" is as foolish an act as pricking their own eyes with their own fingers.
					
					 South Korea is a veritable living hell fraught with the worst human rights records in the world.
					
					 There was a regime change in south Korea, but a great many people advocating justice and truth are still groaning, fastened with the chains of the "Security Law".
					
					 If they are truly interested in human rights issues, they had better settle so many internal problems.

articles.title: S. Korea: Youth Organizations Urge Implementation of Election Commitments
articles.content:
S. Korea: Youth Organizations Urge Implementation of Election Commitments
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean newspaper Media Today, youth and students organizations of south Korea, including the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century, held a press conference in Seoul on July 20 to urge the chief executive to implement his "presidential" election commitments.
					 Speakers recalled that the chief executive pledged himself to eliminate an entrance fee during his election campaign but did not clarify a detailed goal and period for implementing it at his recent plan on "state affairs".
					
					 They also accused him of setting the budget for reduction of registration fee in the plan by half than promised.
					
					 They urged the "government" to take a measure, not repeating the mistakes made by the Park Geun Hye regime.

articles.title: Withdrawal of U.S. Troops Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of U.S. Troops Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Minjok Ilbo carried an editorial on July 20 demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea.
					 Noting that it took nearly 10 years for the GIs present in south Korea to transfer their base to Phyongtaek though it had been scheduled to end in 2008, the editorial urged the U.S. to withdraw its forces from south Korea.
					
					 Recalling that the south Korean people are staging actions in demand of the withdrawal of U.S. forces and THAAD, it urged the regime to get all the bases back from the U.S. before being branded as a traitorous pro-U.S. regime.

articles.title: Withdrawal of THAAD Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of THAAD Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Songju Committee for Struggle against THAAD Deployment and other organizations of south Korea urged the regime to stop the operation of THAAD and get it withdrawn at a press conference on July 20, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 Speakers at the conference demanded that the regime probe the truth behind the whole course of the THAAD deployment and punish those behind its illegal introduction.
					
					 They expressed their will to carry on their struggle until THAAD is withdrawn.

articles.title: Koreans in China Denounce U.S. War Drills against DPRK
articles.content:
Koreans in China Denounce U.S. War Drills against DPRK
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson of the Hailin City branch of the Mudanjiang Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China on July 15 in a statement denounced the U.S. imperialists and its vassal forces for their reckless moves to bring clouds of a nuclear war to hang over Korea.
					 The statement said that the U.S. imperialists keep Korea divided for over half a century but, not content with this, are introducing huge nuclear assets to south Korea and staging dangerous nuclear war drills targeting the north in order to make the Korean nation their slaves, thus bringing the tension on the Korean peninsula to the brink of a nuclear war.
					
					 What is more intolerable is the fact that the south Korean authorities are getting over-heated in the anti-DPRK nuclear racket, pursuant to the U.S. hostile policy, it said, adding:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should draw a lesson from the miserable end of Park Geun Hye and stop thrice-cursed crimes against reunification and the nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Foreign Figures
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings, seminars, book and photo exhibitions and book releasing ceremonies took place in Nepal, Italy, Norway, Sweden and Angola on July 6 and 8 to commemorate the 23rd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venues of events were photos showing the revolutionary careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary activities of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also their works and books and photos introducing the achievements made by the Korean people in building a powerful socialist nation.
					
					 Narayan Man Bijukchhe, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, praised Kim Il Sung as the great leader recognized by the whole world.
					
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, said the President sincerely helped the struggle of the peoples of the countries aspiring after independence, adding that his exploits would be always remembered by humankind.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, said that the demise of the President was a great loss to the Korean people and the world's progressives and that all people are remembering the peerlessly great man with boundless reverence.
					
					 Amalia Alexandr, international secretary of the Angolan Women's Organization, lauded the President for having backed the struggle of African countries for national liberation and building of a new society with all sincerity.
					
					 A letter and message to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Norway and Sweden.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded in Cambodia
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- Media of Cambodia gave special write-ups to the 23rd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung from July 4 to 7.
					 Carrying a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung, the newspaper Nokor Thom Daily said:
					
					 The President is a pioneer and leader of the era of independence as he fathered the Juche idea to show the road ahead of mankind.
					
					 With the faith that the master of the Korean revolution is Korean revolutionaries and the country's independence can be achieved only by the force of its nation, he realized the historic cause of Korea's liberation through a great war against the one million-strong Japanese imperialist army.
					
					 Proceeding from the steadfast principle of independence, he set forth the nation-building line suited to the specific conditions of Korea and built a genuine country for the people where they are the masters of everything and everything serves them.
					
					 He beat back the armed invasion of the U.S. imperialists, which boasted of being "the world's strongest", and won a great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War and built on the debris of war a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 He is a prominent elder statesman in the world who had led the human cause of independence under the banner of independence against imperialism all his life and a peerlessly great man who impressed the world with warm humanity.
					
					 The State Radio Broadcasting Service aired what prominent personages of countries have said, attracted by the noble personality of the President.
					
					 It lauded the noble internationalist obligation of the President, who rendered material and moral assistance to the struggle for national liberation and building of new society in many countries, and introduced in detail how Kimilsungia, the flower of the sun, came to being in the world.
					
					 The Apsara Radio Broadcasting and the FM 90.5 Radio also praised the life of the President who is always alive in the mind of mankind.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful ICBM Test-fire Supported Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful ICBM Test-fire Supported Abroad
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Hungarian Workers' Party and the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in DR Congo made public statements on July 7 and 10 to congratulate the DPRK's successful test-fire of ICBM Hwasong-14.
					 The Hungarian party in its statement said now is the time for the world to clearly see the might of the DPRK and properly formulate policy toward it. In particular, the U.S. should recognize the strategic position of the DPRK and give up the hostile policy toward it, replace the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty and withdraw the aggression forces from south Korea, it added.
					
					 The Juche idea study group of DR Congo said that the whole world is amazed by the news of the successful test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14 in the DPRK.
					
					 The test-launch demonstrated the validity of the Workers' Party of Korea's new line of simultaneously developing the two fronts and the might of the self-reliant defence industry of socialist Korea and clearly showed that any threat and blackmail of the hostile forces can never curb the DPRK, it stressed, adding:
					
					 Being convinced that the successful test-launch of ICBM Hwasong-14 is an option for self-defence to protect peace and security of the Korean peninsula and the region and the rest of the world, we extend support and solidarity to the struggle of the Korean people for building a socialist power and reunifying the country.

articles.title: Nepali Paper Hails DPRK's Test-fire of ICBM Hwasong-14
articles.content:
Nepali Paper Hails DPRK's Test-fire of ICBM Hwasong-14
Pyongyang, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Nepali newspaper Charcha on July 12 carried an article of its editor congratulating the DPRK's successful test-fire of ICBM Hwasong-14 with a photo of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					 The article said:
					
					 In general, to appreciate the might of a country by its territory or population does not fit in today's reality.
					
					 As for the DPRK, it is striking terror into the hearts of the imperialists by successively working eye-opening miracles and achievements, though it is not large in territory or population.
					
					 Big powers assert that nukes should be their own properties and other countries can neither make nor possess nukes. However the heroic Korean people proudly possessed not only nukes but also ICBM capable of carrying them.
					
					 The imperialists escalated international sanctions and pressure on the DPRK and misled the public opinion through media whenever it conducted nuclear tests and launched rockets.
					
					 The test-fire of Hwasong-14 under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un gave a heavy blow to the imperialists.
					
					 The strength of the people guided by a great leader is boundless and no one can curb such people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones del Cuerpo de Agregados Militares
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe felicitaciones del Cuerpo de Agregados Militares
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores y carta de felicitacion que le dedicara el Cuerpo de Agregados Militares en Corea con motivo del 64o aniversario de la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					El agregado militar cubano Roman O. Jimenez Ortega, quien preside el cuerpo, los traslado el dia 24 al general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres Pak Yong Sik, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente egipcio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente egipcio
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Arabe de Egipto, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, con motivo del dia de la Revolucion del 23 de Julio en ese pais.
					Deseando que se logren el progreso, la prosperidad y la estabilidad de Egipto bajo la direccion del destinatario, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que se desarrollaran y se fortaleceran sin parar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju felicita a su par egipcio
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju felicita a su par egipcio
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Pak Pong Ju envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo egipcio, Sherif Ismail, con motivo del 65o aniversario de la Revolucion del 23 de Julio, fiesta nacional del pueblo egipcio.
					Formulando votos por mayores exitos en los trabajos del destinatario por el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju visita el Complejo Minero de Komdok
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju visita el Complejo Minero de Komdok
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Pak Pong Ju averiguo en el terreno las gestiones del Complejo Minero de Komdok.
					En su recorrido por la planta de concentracion No.3, el peloton del Heroe Ko Kyong Chan de la galeria 5 de Abril de la Mina de Kumgol, el taller de produccion de travesanos y otros lugares, el estimulo a los obreros del complejo que aceleran la marcha en gran auge destinada a acoger con exitos laborales sin precedentes la Conferencia de Precursores de Mallima.
					
					En la reunion de los funcionarios interesados efectuada en el terreno, se dio enfasis en el importante papel que desempenan las minas, fabricas y empresas de las zonas de Tanchon y Komdok en el desarrollo de la economia nacional y el mejoramiento de los niveles de la vida del pueblo y se discutieron los problemas para producir y suministrar a tiempo en las unidades relacionadas los equipos, materiales y materias primas necesarios.
					
					Anteriormente, el premier recorrio el proceso de produccion de ladrillo refractario que se construye en la Mina Heroina Juventud de Taehung y destaco la necesidad de terminar cuanto antes esta obra.

articles.title: Grupo de propaganda artistica juvenil ofrece funcion por el 27 de Julio
articles.content:
Grupo de propaganda artistica juvenil ofrece funcion por el 27 de Julio
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- En homenaje al aniversario 64 de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, tuvo lugar el dia 24 en la Casa Central de la Juventud la funcion del grupo central de propaganda artistica juvenil "27 de Julio, dia de victoria eterna".
					En la escena, que descorrio su telon con el coro "Gloria al General Kim Jong Un", se presentaron la narracion y el coro mixto "Marcha del 27 de julio", la musica ligera para el duo de trompeta "Trote del caballo del Paektu", la danza "En el manantial", el cuarteto masculino "Cancion de orgullo de unidades guardias", el solo femenino "!Cuenten, fuegos artificiales de la victoria!", entre otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes elogiaron las hazanas revolucionarias del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien logro la victoria brillante en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria y del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien convirtio la patria en la potencia militar de talla mundial y el pais poseedor de armas nucleares.
					
					Ademas, se interpretaron el coro masculino "Cancion de la defensa de la Patria", el solo masculino "Mi cancion en la trinchera", etc.
					
					Disfrutaron el espectaculo el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Il Hwan, el primer secretario del CC de la Union de la Juventud, Jon Yong Nam, los funcionarios de la misma entidad juvenil y los jovenes y estudiantes.

articles.title: Tiene lugar recital de ganadores del concurso de solistas
articles.content:
Tiene lugar recital de ganadores del concurso de solistas
Pyongyang, 24 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 24 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el recital de los ganadores del concurso nacional de solos de canto y de instrumentos musicales de jovenes y estudiantes para celebrar el 64o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En la ocasion, los interpretes elogiaron las hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung, genial comandante de acero y estratega militar quien dirigio al ejercito y pueblo coreanos a la victoria en guerra emprendiendo sin parar la inspeccion al frente bajo la lluvia de proyectiles y manifesto asi a todo el mundo el temperamento y dignidad de la Corea heroica.
					
					El duo femenino "!Cuenten, fuegos artificiales de la victoria!", el solo de acordeon "A la batalla decisiva" y el solo de violin "Mi cancion en la trinchera" hicieron recordar el espiritu de vida o muerte y el indoblegable temperamento de lucha con que combatieron los heroes en la decada de 1950 para defender la patria.
					
					El solo femenino de la obra maestra "?Donde esta el querido General?" y otras piezas llenaron a los espectadores del sentimiento de gran veneracion al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					El recital, terminado con el coro "Defenderemos a costa de la vida al General Kim Jong Un", demostro bien la decision revolucionaria de 5 millones de vanguardias juveniles de repetir el 27 de julio para la victoria final bajo la orientacion del Maximo Dirigente.
					
					Vieron el recital Jon Yong Nam, primer secretario del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud, y otros funcionarios de la misma y los estudiantes y jovenes.
